course.title: Statistical Sleuthing Through Linear Models
course.meeting_text: Tu., Th., 11:30–1, and weekly sections to be arranged.
course.description: A serious introduction to statistical inference with linear models and related methods. Topics include t-tools and permutation-based alternatives, multiple-group comparisons, analysis of variance, linear regression, model checking and refinement, and causation versus correlation. Emphasis on thinking statistically, evaluating assumptions, and developing tools for real-life applications.
course.prerequisites: Statistics 100 or equivalent and Mathematics 19a and 19b or equivalent.
